pageContext.description: Typology: circular tapered shank expands at top to almost flat underside of head separated from dome by good angle; slight bend in shank poss. orig. ; in profile head tilted slightly forward on shank,  Manufacture: edges of both perforations crisp, cast in with hollow of head; possibly a little less hollow at rear than front of head; 24 grooves encircling shank and enter underside of head - ribs between with rounded profiles - poss. all cast; fringe motif of 3 triangles at base; groove on head just above bottom angle with 3 others bordering bands of alternate diagonals,  Condition: much differential wear - decoration v. worn on top of head - top 2 bands, also worst on rear face of head, including lowest band; tip virt. intact
pageContext.surface: brown shiny p. over most; few spots of lumpy corr. and peckings to light green - including one scarring head;
pageContext.remarks: Labels/Markings Red ink: E1786, Sub Inf via Colin Shell, Camb. Univ.
